poem:
### At the Edge of Story

In a corner,  
a boy of just  
seven stares,  
spellbound —  
worlds unfolding  
in soft syllables.  
  
Burglar Bill  
steals his troubles,  
stows them away  
in pockets deep.  
  
For moments,  
the room listens,  
held in the quiet  
magic of words:  
making  
of stories,  
a refuge.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘No one could compete’: readers remember the magic of Allan Ahlberg’s stories Burglar Bill ‘I worked with kids who struggled – this one boy would listen with rapture’ Thirty years ago I was a healthcare assistant working for CAMHS in a major city. It was a brilliant creative job where I worked with primary school kids who were struggling with home and school life. We had one little boy, aged seven, who was a world". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
